comment._content: According to Wikipedia, he would later go on to form a rock band in Scotland.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: You are joking, of course. On June 28, 1914, Austrian Archduke Franz Ferdinand and his wife, Sophie, Duchess of Hohenberg, were assassinated in Sarajevo, while on a visit to Serbia, which then was a province of Austria-Hungary. The assassination was a precipitating event in the clash of alliances that produced World War I. The assassin was a Serbian nationalist, Gavrilo Princip.
